subject: Economics
title: The Spice Trade: Wars Fought Over Flavor
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Spice Trade: Wars Fought Over Flavor.

hook.text: In the 1400s, a sack of pepper was worth more than a human life.

buildup.text: Spices preserved food, masked rot, and served as medicine.

discovery.text: Arab merchants controlled the trade and kept sources secret for centuries.

twist.text: Columbus sailed west to find a shorter spice route and accidentally stumbled on the Americas.

climax.text: The spice trade funded empires, launched colonialism, and connected every continent.

punchline.text: The modern world was built because Europeans wanted their food to taste better.

quiz.question: How did the spice trade change world history?
options: The search for spice routes drove exploration, colonialism, and the connection of all continents
